config_description: Diagnostic Events If enabled, diagnostic events can be helpful for troubleshooting operational issues. Emitted events contain details on internal state and temporal relationships across events, accessible by clients via JMX.
developer_understanding_on_working: The 'diagnostic_events_enabled' configuration is used to determine if diagnostic events are enabled in the system. It is checked in various methods like 'publish', 'isEnabled', and 'isDiagnosticsEnabled' to control the flow of publishing and subscribing to diagnostic events.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'diagnostic_events_enabled' configuration depends on the usage of diagnostic events in the system. If diagnostic events are frequently used for troubleshooting operational issues, then this configuration will be checked frequently.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'diagnostic_events_enabled' configuration option on the system is that it controls the availability of diagnostic events. If disabled, diagnostic events will not be published or subscribed to, potentially affecting the troubleshooting capabilities of the system.
